title: 5 Easy Steps to Have Invisible Highlight Names on Instagram

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. This looks like a camera with a multicolored background. Log into your account if you aren't already. You can also use Instagram in a web browser at https://www.instagram.com/ .

steps.title: Post
steps.content: Post or edit a Highlight . Highlights are curated Stories you can display on your profile until you manually remove them. [1] X Research source To add a new Highlight, navigate to your profile page. Tap the + icon. To edit an existing Highlight, tap the Highlight, and then tap ••• . Tap Edit Highlight .

steps.title: Copy ‎ .
steps.content: Copy ‎ . This is a special blank Unicode character. If you're using a mobile device, tap and hold the character, and then tap Copy . If you're using a computer, highlight the character with your mouse. Press CTRL + C (Windows) or CMD + C (Mac) to copy. Alternatively, you can visit this website and click or tap the Copy to clipboard button. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Paste the code into the "Name" field.
steps.content: Paste the code into the "Name" field. If you just leave it blank, Instagram will automatically input the name Highlights . When the code is pasted into the field, it will be recognized as its own character.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This is in the top-right corner. The Instagram Highlight name will now be invisible. You can also use this trick to change your display name on Instagram.
